meanings.definition: The long threadlike part of a nerve cell along which impulses are conducted.
meanings.sent1: The axones carry messages from the brain to the rest of the body.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the axones to understand how our nerves work.
meanings.sent3: The axones in the nerve cell were having a race to see who could transmit the message faster.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the axones, always moving forward with purpose.
meanings.sent5: The axones were like tiny messengers, delivering urgent signals throughout the body.

meanings.definition: The main stem or central part of a nerve cell.
meanings.sent1: The axones play a crucial role in transmitting signals within the nerve cell.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are researching ways to protect the axones from damage.
meanings.sent3: The axones in the nerve cell were throwing a party to celebrate their important job.
meanings.sent4: His leadership was like the axones, guiding the team towards success.
meanings.sent5: The axones stood tall and strong, the backbone of the nerve cell's communication system.
